poem:
**Broken Jar**

Fragments of bronze,  
child's laughter echoes—  
innocence spills  
from shattered ages.  
Parents, heads hung,  
yet cherish  
that wild abandon,  
unruly sparks  
of growing beyond.  

Years will smooth  
what time fractured;  
memories,  
polished bright,  
held up to the light—  
moments like these  
a mosaic.
